etymology.description: Unknown -> phonetic component with unclear origin and meaning -> often used in the context of phonetics or as a component in compound characters
etymology.interpretation: The character 尌 is primarily used as a phonetic element rather than having its own standalone meaning. It appears in the inside of other characters but lacks a definitive etymological breakdown.

examples.chinese: 这个字的结构中(這個字的結構中)，尌作为声旁存在(尌作為聲旁存在)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zì de jiégòu zhōng, shù zuòwéi shēngpáng cúnzài.
examples.english: In the structure of this character, the component 尌 functions as the phonetic element.

examples.chinese: 书法家研究汉字时(書法家研究漢字時)，仔细观察声旁尌的用法(仔細觀察聲旁尌的用法)。
examples.pinyin: Shūfǎ jiā yánjiū Hànzì shí, zǐxì guānchá shēngpáng shù de yòngfǎ.
examples.english: When calligraphers study Chinese characters, they carefully observe the usage of the phonetic component 尌.
